critique: The document establishes the National Resources Board and outlines its functions, which include preparing a program and plan for the development and use of land, water, and other national resources. It emphasizes the coordination of projects among Federal, State, and local governments and the division of responsibility and cost among them. The document also abolishes the National Planning Board and transfers its powers and duties to the National Resources Board. It directs the Federal Emergency Administration of Public Works to allot funds to the National Resources Board to carry out its functions.
